column4: fyi, removing chromium is probably more effort then it's worth... for one thing, you need meta-packages to upgrade to a new version of ubuntu... so down the road it could cause issues.  ALSO, pay close attention to everything that gets uninstalled.
yes, i will keep chromium, but i don't like anything from google

my solution to cruft.  start from mini (aka netinstall) - and DON'T select a desktop (*buntu-desktop) and then create a script for your install, of ONLY the packages you want/need, 0 cruft.  Not good for upgrading in ubuntu to new versions!
thanks, in the moment i keep it as it is, till i consider another distribution
